text: :question: *File upload:* I have had conversations with some of you on the problems around allowing users to upload files in your extensions. I want to get more details on use cases here. If you have encountered this problem, please comment, and we might ask follow up questions.
Hi Kobe, I posted a question on file upload just now and tagged you. How about we take the conversation there?

Currently not a massive problem. I use the iframe feature with dropbox file requests to collect files for a lot of things (you can dynamically create the file request through a serverless function and open it in the iframe)
I also have a couple of custom uploads that sit on CMS pages for uploading things to either HubSpot files or Supabase

Hey Kobe - this is from A8's CRM Card playbook and may be an old version (I’m not sure, but I have raised the issue). The issue has been raised with the team behind it, but there was a miscommunication when creating the playbook between what should show up on an actual card and what should show in an iFrame modal. Their team has created components in the same style as HubSpot’s UI to create these types of experiences and keep them feeling natural, but there was some confusion with the designer of the playbook who put some of those custom iFrame examples directly on a card.
Hey <@U26BLKGE4> , do you mean it’s not possible to do this?
Not directly in the card as shown above, no
Right that’s so slack of A8 lol
Do you have time for a quick phone chat? I’d love to pick your brains for 5 minutes?
I was thinking of doing exactly what Carter just suggested. But would way prefer to have native file upload options…
Yeah 100%, just saying it's not an issue that stops me from moving forward with my projects
<@U01QVR44MEY> Would you be able to show me how you managed to get the dropbox iframe working?

Sorry I miswrote, I use both Box and Dropbox. <https://developer.box.com/reference/post-file-requests-id-copy/> you can do this through Box with this API to create the request, and then use the URL that gets returned as the Iframe url
With dropbox you can only embed a particular file or folder with view and download permissions, just no create permissions (upload)
